Key Match Events: DJ Herz threw five no-hit innings, allowing just three walks while striking out five.
Dylan Crews finished 2-for-3 with a walk, double, home run and a pair of RBIs.
Andres Chaparro hit a two-run homer to tie the game at four.
James Wood hit a two-out single that sparked a four-run rally, paving the way for the Nationals' 8-6 comeback victory.
Post-Match Reflections: Derek Shelton said the offense's inability to manufacture runs against the opposing starting pitcher led to their defeat.
Shelton also mentioned that the bullpen was even worse in game two, a common theme for the Pirates in the second half of the season.
Shelton praised Mitch Keller's ability to respond from a poor outing last weekend in Cleveland with a strong start in Game 2.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pirates were swept by the Nationals in the doubleheader.
The Nationals won the first game 5-3 and the second 8-6.
The Pirates tallied 16 hits in the two games, four less than Washington's total of 20.
The doubleheader marked just the second doubleheader of the Pirates' 2024 season and the first that took place at PNC Park.
Others: Joey Bart and Oneil Cruz made blunders leading to Washington runs.
Ryan Borucki has now allowed four earned runs in the three innings he's pitched since returning from the injured list on September 1.
Bryan De La Cruz bounced into a game-ending double play, securing Washington's first victory.
Kyle Finnegan recorded a save in both victories, bringing his total to 37 on the year.
